messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jeff Miller" <bywater@...>
> I've been asked how to compose a set of JUnit test suites, then run
> each in its own Java VM (to separate static initializer effects for a
> set of previously developed classes).
>
> Does anyone have any suggestions for a recipe or approach?
>
> Is this something that I'd do at the runner side (walking the
> composite and decorating each top-level suite with an InvokeRemotely
> or something?), or at the framework side?
>
You don't need a seperate VM, just a seperate classloader, Write your own
classloader so that the class gets initialised for each test. The
reloading classloader of the SwingUI may do this for you already.

- Neil Swingler
